text: hey everybody Thomas Joseph here now
Christmas cookies are the perfect way to
spread some holiday cheer
but the real conundrum comes when it
comes to the decorating of cookies today
I'm gonna show you three easy ways to
decorate your Christmas cookies the
first method is feathering so I'm going
to make peppermint cookies and what you
need is some royal icing what I'm doing
is I have them in these little bottles
with a fine tip I'm gonna trace the
outline of my cookie here creating a
border it's called building a dam and
then you're gonna fill the dam just
going back and forth in a zigzag motion
take a toothpick or a skewer and gently
swirl the icing into all of the empty
spaces now I prefer to work with a
thicker royal icing but sometimes get an
uneven surface because the icing is so
thick so a way to fix that you take the
cookie and shake it gently and what it
does is it smooths out the royal icing
into any of those spaces or ripples that
don't have very much you can also tap it
and now to create the peppermint swirl
red icing the same consistency so all
you really need to do is use a little
bit of that food coloring gel paste
works the best you're gonna draw lines
for lines should be good
take another skewer draw a line through
the icing and what this does is it holds
the icing creating this
feathered look or the swirled look and
you have a swirled peppermint then just
let this dry if you have any cellophane
on hand and some little peppermint ties
here you can really make it look like a
peppermint candy now a Christmas tree
can you do the tree just like the
peppermint candy cookies dragged through
the icing moving towards the point of
the tree wipe the skewer every time you
swipe through give the cookie a shake
and there you have it a really fun and
easy way to decorate using the
feathering technique okay so now for
this
second technique I have an ornament
shape here and it is simply iced with
some royal icing that is completely set
so this is nice and dry and I have
different colors of royal icing in front
of me that are a little bit thinner and
these are natural sponges use a little
bit of water here to moisten the sponge
all you do is you dip the sponge into
the facing and to ensure that you don't
have too heavy of a speckles you can
blot off your sponge on a piece of paper
towel you're dabbing the sponge onto the
cookie creating this really cool
speckled look now try to avoid the
cookie itself and just speckle on top of
that white royal icing that looks
amazing now you can really use any color
that you would like and so there you
have it a very simple yet really
impressive way to embellish your holiday
cookies so now for the third technique
and that is pipe and brush so I have
some thick royal icing that I've colored
with a little bit of gold food coloring
and I have a very thin tip on the
squeeze bottle here use a cookie that
has been iced and dried so this is a
ornament shape draw with my royal icing
a line along the bottom of the cookie
and now take a small brush this is a
brush that you can buy at a craft store
or a specialty cake shop moisten the
bristles a little bit with some water
and hold the icing with the bristles of
the brush starting at one end you can
pull inward creating this wonderful
brushed look to your cookie this is a
great technique to use whenever you're
making like seashell cookies looks great
on ornaments like this if you're doing
an angel that would be great now once
you have one line down pipe another line
of icing overlapping where you brushed
repeat this process until you're all the
way at the top of the cookie for an easy
way to embellish the outline you can
gently make little dots around the
circumference of the or
this beaded border really finishes this
cookie off and it looks really amazing
fit for any Christmas tree so there you
have it 3 simple yet super amazing ways
to embellish your holiday cookies I hope
I've inspired you to try some of these
at home enjoy guys
